description: From Latin dēmulcēns, present active participle of dēmulceō (“to stroke caressingly; to soften, soothe, allure”), from dē- (“prefix meaning ‘from; of’”) + mulceō (“to move or touch gently or lightly, to stroke; to make pleasant or sweet; to soften, soothe, alleviate, relieve”).

adjectives.description: demulcent (comparative more demulcent, superlative most demulcent)

entries.meaning: (medicine) A soothing medication used to relieve pain in inflamed tissues.
